poem:
Title: A Narrative Unfolds in Visions of 'Dead Hot'

Dead Hot, ablaze in
the ordinary screen,
Oparah and Hasna's quicksilver
performance - reflections flit

A mystery-comedy, a
horror-romance dance,
each step echoing in the
mirth of unknowing - 

Coben's quill unfurls
layers of life, love
from the ashes -
our laughter blooms, terrified,
romanced and thrilled - 

Lit by the lucid
flares of story,
powerful in its unpredictability.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dead Hot review – it’s Skins meets Queer As Folk … but way weirder Dead Hot comes pre-loaded with charisma. Its leads, Vivian Oparah from Rye Lane, and Bilal Hasna, last seen in the underrated Extraordinary, sparkle their way through their scenes, lighting up what might otherwise have been a humdrum mystery. I say mystery, but it’s also a comedy-thriller-horror-romance. There is a lot going on. It has been created and written by Charlotte Coben,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Dead Hot review – it’s Skins meets Queer As Folk … but way weirder Dead Hot comes pre-loaded with charisma. Its leads, Vivian Oparah from Rye Lane, and Bilal Hasna, last seen in the underrated Extraordinary, sparkle their way through their scenes, lighting up what might otherwise have been a humdrum mystery. I say mystery, but it’s also a comedy-thriller-horror-romance. There is a lot going on. It has been created and written by Charlotte Coben,
